name: The Black Swan Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Having previously visited the hotel in January for the first time we booked another one night stay for Valentines Day..
reviews.title: Confused due to inconsistancy

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our room was large,comfortable and warm, the bed was soft, as was the linen, and the ensuite a little dated and could do with some refurbishment (during our stay we were told that this is planned) A bootle of wine was included in the tariff, I upgraded this to a bottle of champagne. This was waiting chilled in our room on arrival. The housekeeping was good, the room was fully serviced whilst we were at dinner.
reviews.title: A Relaxing weekend I think not!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel was very busy and this showed when we attended the lounge for afternoom tea. Fresh scones, jam and cream arrived then we had to wait nearly twenty minutes for our tea. Insufficient number of staff, full trays everywhere?
reviews.title: second class treatment

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Now to our evening meal. I approached the Maître d' with our bottle of champagne and asked if this could be chilled at our table? This was flatly refused. We were not allowed to take it into the restaurant. Why when I had purchased it in the hotel? No explanation offered? We entered the bar area, and sat there for thirty minutes, no menu produced. Again a lack of staff. Eventually a drinks order was taken and a slightly disappointing simple canape arrived, identical to our previous stay?
reviews.title: very good standards, excellent restaurant

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The menu was good however we were informed that all the duck had gone? In the busy restaurant it was clear that the staff were under great pressure and could not cope with the number of covers? Typically we had to ask three times for a jug of water? Food was going to wrong tables including ours? We were offered our main course before we had eaten our starter? Lack of cutlery? Staff argueing with each other? My wifes starter a fish course tasted as though the salt canister had been dropped in it? At no point were we asked if we were enjoying the food? Left the restaurant unhappy and spoke with the Maître d' and registered these issues, he seemed uninterested? At breakfast next morning we got the impression that something had been said as the waiter who had served us the previous evening was very distant with my wife and I but very attentive with other guests? Breakfast was very good. On checking out we were over charged and to finish things off the receptionist was also not interested as to our comments highlighting the inconsistancy?
reviews.title: Superb Short Break

reviews.text: Well... what can I say? we arrived with 3 other couples to celebrate a friends 40th Birthday on Saturday. Originally we had planned to goto the Crab & Lobster in Asenby; but for a change and the fact that there was a Spa around the corner at The Faversham Arms we settled on the Yorkshire Life Hotel/Restraunt of the year 2009.
reviews.title: Fawlty Towers at its best!

reviews.text: On arrival we checked in and obtained a free parking pass for the Car Park at the front of the Hotel. [Nice touch] We then went upto our rooms. The rooms are a long way from reception and down narrow corridors, but then again it is an old building. Housekeeping throw in the odd obstical with Henry Vaccums and linen on the floor outside rooms. Anyway arrived at room 34. Ok standard of appearance but the bath had a constant drip; to the extent that the bath was water stained as it had been dripping longer than a few days. Wanting to make sure our other friends who we travelled with didnt have a better room we nipped into room 32. In this room there was a large skeleton of a Daddy Longlegs on the roof. It had clearly been there for sometime, and was too big to miss! This begs the question about overall housekeeping quality and hotel maintenance.
reviews.title: Will return

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Anyway, when the rest of our party arrived we went down to the hotel bar for a quick bite to eat prior to the Boys going for a walk and the 4 girls heading to the Verbena Spa at the Feversham Arms. Cracking food for all except the most crucified Bacon Sandwich ever! overall the service was exceptionally slow.
reviews.title: A lovely heritage hotel with a warm welcome and good food in N.Yorks

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: In the evening, there was a wedding function on at the hotel. But the early problems that were going to continue throughout the night was the lack of staff. The bar was almost permanently unmanned! not great when you have a thirst and feel in a good mood to spend some cash.
reviews.title: A Hotel in Crisis?

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We ordered Champagne and moved to the restauraunt for Dinner. It was here that the comedy really began......
reviews.title: A tasty hotel!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Just back from a short break at the Black Swan. Traditional, comfortable hotel located right on the market square in the centre of Helmsley. All rooms are named after dales. Nice cozy room overlooking the garden, friendly and attentive staff, great food. Service a little slow on the first night but food worth waiting for, beautifully presented. The whole place smacks of old world charm . Very relaxing and comfortable stay - would recommend for those wanting to explore North Yorkshire.
reviews.title: Excellent hotel in quaint Yorkshire market town

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Having read some of the previous revues we were a little apprehensive about our stay. Glad to report, however, that we didn't experience any of the niggles that have affected others. Check in was handled well. Bedroom was comfortable and clean, if a little dated. Our stay included a champagne cream tea. We were served this in one of the lounges one of the staff even lit the fire for us. Now to dinner: glass of champers in the bar, where they took our food and wine order promptly with no problems. The restaurant itself was lovely- we were seated under the "starlight" part of the ceiling- very romantic. Even though the inclusive menu sounded and looked nice enough on other diners plates we opted for a few of the courses where supplements applied. The food was excellent. Beautifully cooked venison and halibut amongst our choices. The only negative is the price of wines by the glass- a little steep to say the least. However I would definately return. Helmsley is a very nice place to visit
reviews.title: Excellent food, great service.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Overlooking the market place in the old market town we stayed overnight on mothering sunday, and despite being busy we still found the service to be great.
reviews.title: a beautiful character hotel

reviews.text: The food is fantastic and up to michelin standard with good service overall.
reviews.title: What an amazing wedding!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: It is an old world hotel with real fires, afternoon tea and good service.
reviews.title: A mixed trip!
I didn't need to worry!
reviews.text: I booked the Black Swan as a birthday suprise for my husband before reading the reviews on trip advisor and I didn't need to worry. The room was great and although quite a walk from reception it isn't that bad. We booked a heat experiance at the Verbena Spa at the Faversham Arms nearby which was fantastic. The meal at the black swan was amazing and the service was too. The added extras were fantastic. Although the wine is quite expensive it's the same as most hotels so can't grumble. Breakfast was also fantastic. Would definateley return back here!

We got married here on the 13th of March 2010 our day was soo perfect! After a lot of consideration having visited lots of potential locations we finally decided on the Black swan in Helmsley. We do not regret our decision!
reviews.title: We had an amazing wedding here and soo many wonderful memories!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The wedding organiser Jayne was excellent and helped us to plan a great day. Barry the wedding coordinator on the day helped to ensure everything ran smoothly and was very professional throughout and all the staff very attentive.
reviews.title: Nice, but not nice enough for the price.

reviews.text: The food was wonderful plates were polished off by everyone I thought the sticky toffee pudding was very yummy!
reviews.title: Left Early

reviews.text: The venue is lovely in the lovely old market town of Helmsley and such a beautiful part of the North York moors with lots to explore in the area.
reviews.title: Relieved to have a wonderful stay!

description: Located in one of Yorkshire’s prettiest market towns, The Black Swan in Helmsley is a superb historic inn, turned boutique hotel. Dating back to the C15th the hotel, rich in history and charm, blends antiques with classic contemporary design creating the perfect place for a relaxing break. With its own award winning restaurant and tearoom, the Black Swan provides the perfect backdrop for a romantic getaway and a chance to escape the everyday stresses and strains.
